page.title: 07Ashchurch Army Camp 1
page.content: This is a page about {Ashchurch C.V.D camp. C.V.D stands for Central Vehicle Depot.This along with Hilton which only has civilians working there,and Ludgershall which holds the tanks are the main depots in the U.K. Ashchurch is the H.Q of the three camps.The army camp was built by the Americans in 1942.In 1974 the camp was changed to the Central Depot.Ashchurch is a very independent camp.They have their own carpenter. They also have their own workshop (for fixing vehicles), and inspecting them (like an M.O.T.) .There are 140 soldiers and 500 civilian employees. In the sheds they stack trailers on top of each other for extra space.This method is called piggy back.The area of the camp is 145,270 square metres. The perimeter of the camp is 2.27 miles.
